segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool, reaching for cookies like he’s on a mission.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That stool looks like it’s about to tip over any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s stretching so far, and his sister is just waiting for him to hand her one.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe they’re doing this right behind their mom’s back.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The mom is right there, drying dishes, and she has no idea what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the boy is going to fall, and it’s going to be a mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is still pouring everywhere, and the floor is getting slippery.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if anyone is going to notice before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is just chaotic, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I’m watching a slow-motion accident.
segments.speaker: PAR
